Event.name: Out_of_existence
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> has ceased to exist.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Theses termites</fex> are <t>history</t>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">Hillary</fex> is <t>toast</t> <fex name="Time">after Texas and Ohio</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">They</fex> are <t>gone</t> <fex name="Explanation">because you killed them all</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>Concrete or abstract entity that does not exist after the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the Place where the <fen>Entity</fen> (saliently) does not exist.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>A point at which the <fen>Entity</fen> (saliently) does not exist.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE labels the <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> of the destruction or disappearance of the <fen>Entity</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the length of time before the <fen>Entity</fen> comes into existence again.</def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition: <def-root>The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which no longer exists. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: toast.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (effectively) out of existence; no longer relevant

lexUnit.name: history.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: imminent departure, dismissal, or death.

lexUnit.name: gone.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: no longer in existence; depleted

lexUnit.name: a thing of the past.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: out of existence; having faded
